repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia, Former Yugoslav Republic of -
            Pension Reform Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated highly
            satisfactory, and sustainability of project outcomes is
            likely. The overall performance of both the World Bank and
            the Borrower is rated satisfactory. Lessons emerged
            regarding the need for technical assistance to support
            substantial policy reforms. They are: 1) Pairing a TA
            operation with an adjustment lending one was an excellent
            combination, which helped the counterpart to achieve the
            policy objectives of adjustment program with much higher
            quality, stronger ownership, and better assurance for
            sustainability. 2) This project is proof that with limited
            resources and their strategic use, major achievements can be
            nmade in moving policy reforms forward. 3) The
            Borrower's commitment and ownership are essential for
            successful implementation of critical policy reforms. 4) The
            way in which pension reform was managed and coordinated is
            an excellent example of being able to carry out complex and
            sensitive pension policy reforms by involving all
            stakeholders. 5) Continuity of staff is important. 6) Bank
            support to the Steering Committee in designing and
            implementing a public information campaign was essential for
            two reasons: to achieve a consensus on the need for the
            pension reform among major stakeholders and 2) to get public
            support for the planned policy reforms. 7) Even in countries
            with a more stable political and civil environment, the
            passage of legislation through the Parliament might require
            more time than planned.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Pension Reform Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Pension Reform
            Technical Assistance Project (PERTAP) are to support: (a)
            the design of the pension policy reforms under the
            Borrower's Social Sector Adjustment Program, and the
            development of the necessary legislation to this effect; and
            (b) build capacity in the Ministry of Labor and Social
            Protection (MLSP) and the Pension Fund. The project
            components include: pension reform design to include the
            design of the pension reform program, the development of
            actuarial capacity for pension reform, the development of
            financing plan for the transition, and the design of a
            public information campaign; legislative framework to
            include the reform of legislation of the public pension
            program, the development of law for private pensions, and
            the development of support for the passage of legislation;
            and project management to establish a Project Coordination
            Unit (PCU) under the responsibility of the Ministry of Labor
            and Social Policy.
